chapter.title: Panels and containers
chapter.para: This chapter details those components which act as panels and containers to hold groups of other components.

section.title: <rich:modalPanel>
section.para: The <rich:modalPanel> component provides a modal panel or window that blocks interaction with the rest of the application while active. It can be easily positioned on the screen, dragged to a new position by the user, and re-sized.

important.title: Placement
important.para: The <rich:modalPanel> component should always be placed outside the original <h:form>, and must include its own <h:form> if performing submissions.

section.para: By default, the modal panel can be both re-sized and re-positioned by the user. The minimum possible size for the panel can be set with the These abilities can be deactivated by setting resizable or movable to false as necessary. The state of the modal panel, including size and position on screen, can be maintained and restored after submitting and reloading by setting keepVisualState="true".
If showWhenRendered="true" then the modal panel will display when the page is first loaded.

section.title: <rich:panel>
section.para: The <rich:panel> component is a bordered panel with an optional header.

No attributes need to be listed for basic usage. To add a header to the panel, use the header attribute to specify the text to appear in the header. Alternatively the header can be constructed using a header facet.

section.title: <rich:panelBar>
section.para: The <rich:panelBar> is a series of panels stacked on top of each other, each collapsed such that only the header of the panel is showing. When the header of a panel is clicked, it is expanded to show the content of the panel. Clicking on a different header will collapse the previous panel and epand the selected one. Another name for the component is "accordion". Each panel in contained in a <rich:panelBar> component is a <rich:panelBarItem> component.

section.title: <rich:panelBarItem>
section.para: The <rich:panelBarItem> component is a panel for use with the <rich:panelBar> component.

section.title: <rich:simpleTogglePanel>
section.para: The <rich:simpleTogglePanel> component is a collapsible panel that shows or hides content when the header bar is activated. It is a simplified version of <rich:togglePanel> component.
Basic usage requires only the label attribute to be specified, which provides the title for the header element.
The switching mode for performing submissions is determined by the switchType attribute, which can have one of the following three values:

listitem.para: server, the default setting, which causes the <rich:simpleTogglePanel> component to perform a common submission, completely re-rendering the page. Only one panel at a time is uploaded to the client side.
ajax, which causes the <rich:simpleTogglePanel> component to perform an Ajax form submission, and the content of the panel is rendered. Only one panel at a time is uploaded to the client side.
client, which causes <rich:simpleTogglePanel> components to update on the client side, re-rendering themselves and any additional components listed with the render attribute.

section.para: If the <rich:simpleTogglePanel> component uses opened="true", the panel is open and expanded, otherwise it is closed and collapsed.
The openMarker and closeMarker attributes can be used to define custom icons for the expanding header.

section.title: <rich:tabPanel>
section.para: The <rich:tabPanel> component provides a set of tabbed panels for displaying one panel of content at a time. The tabs can be highly customized and themed.

note.title: Form elements required
note.para: All <rich:tabPanel> components should be wrapped in a form element so that content is correctly submitted.

section.para: The switching mode for performing submissions is determined by the switchType attribute, which can have one of the following three values:

listitem.para: server, the default setting, which causes the <rich:tabPanel> component to perform a common submission, completely re-rendering the page. Only one panel at a time is uploaded to the client side.
ajax, which causes the <rich:tabPanel> component to perform an Ajax form submission, and the content of the panel is rendered. Only one panel at a time is uploaded to the client side.
client, which causes <rich:tabPanel> components to update on the client side, re-rendering themselves and any additional components listed with the render attribute.

section.para: The selectedTab attribute holds the active tab name.

The tabs themselves can be aligned using the headerAlignment attribute. The attribute can be set to left, center, or right, aligning the header tabs to the left, center, or right of the top edge of the panel respectively. If no alignment is specified, left-alignment is the default behavior.

section.title: <rich:tab>
section.para: The <rich:tab> component represents an individual tab inside a <rich:tabPanel> component, including the tab's content. Clicking on the tab header will bring its corresponding content to the front of other tabs.
Basic usage of the <rich:tab> component requires the label attribute, which provides the text on the tab header. The content of the tab is then detailed inside the <rich:tab> tags.
An individual tab can be disabled by setting disabled="true". Disabled tabs cannot be activated or switched to.

The switching mode for performing submissions can be inherited from switchMode attribute of the parent <rich:tabPanel> component, or set individually for each <rich:tab> component. Refer to for details on the switchMode attribute.

There are two event handlers that are unique to the <rich:tab> component. The ontabenter attribute points to the function to perform when the mouse enters the tab, while the ontableave attribute points to the function to perform when the mouse leaves the tab.

section.title: <rich:togglePanel>
section.para: The <rich:togglePanel> component is a wrapper component with named facets. Each facet is displayed after activating a corresponding <rich:toggleControl> component.

The initial state of the component can be configured using the initialState attribute, which points to a facet name to display. Alternatively, setting initialState="empty", the initial state will be blank until the user selects an option.
The order in which the facets are shown can be defined using the statusOrder attribute, listing the facet names separated by commas, as shown in .

example.title: State order example
example.programlisting: <rich:togglePanel id="panel" initialState="panelB" switchType="client" stateOrder="panelA,panelB,panelC"> <f:facet name="panelA"> ... </f:facet> <f:facet name="panelB"> ... </f:facet> <f:facet name="panelC"> ... </f:facet> </rich:togglePanel> <rich:toggleControl for="panel" value="Switch"/>

section.title: <rich:toggleControl>
section.para: The <rich:toggleControl> component works with a <rich:togglePanel> component to switch between panel states. It can be located either inside or outside the <rich:togglePanel> component, and can be used to switch to a specific state or cycle through a set of states.

Basic usage for the <rich:toggleControl> requires the for attribute, which points to the id attribute of the <rich:togglePanel> that it controls. The value attribute specifies the label of the toggle button.

The switchToState attribute can be used to explicitly set a target panel for the toggle to activate. If no switchToState attribute is defined, the toggle will switch to the next panel listed in the switchOrder attribute of the <rich:toggleControl> component. shows the use of the switchToState attribute.

example.title: Switching panel states
example.programlisting: <rich:togglePanel id="panel" initialState="empty" switchType="client"> <f:facet name="first"> <h:panelGroup> <rich:toggleControl for="helloForm:panel" value="Empty" switchToState="empty"/> <rich:toggleControl for="helloForm:panel" value=" Second" switchToState="second"/> <!--Some content--> </h:panelGroup> </f:facet> <f:facet name="second"> <h:panelGroup> <rich:toggleControl for="helloForm:panel" value="Empty" switchToState="empty"/> <rich:toggleControl for="helloForm:panel" value=" first" switchToState="first"/> <!--Some content--> </h:panelGroup> </f:facet> <f:facet name="empty"> <h:panelGroup> <rich:toggleControl for="helloForm:panel" value="first" switchToState="first"/> <rich:toggleControl for="helloForm:panel" value=" second" switchToState="second"/> </h:panelGroup> </f:facet> </rich:togglePanel>
